name: BKEMV
indications: bkemv complement inhibitor indicated : treatment patients paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria ( pnh ) reduce hemolysis . ( 1.1 ) treatment patients atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome ( ahus ) inhibit complement-mediated thrombotic microangiopathy . ( 1.2 ) limitation bkemv indicated treatment patients shiga toxin e. coli related hemolytic uremic syndrome ( stec-hus ) . treatment generalized myasthenia gravis ( gmg ) adult patients anti-acetylcholine receptor ( achr ) antibody positive . ( 1.3 )
contraindications: intravenous infusion pnh regimen : ( 2.2 ) ahus regimen : ( 2.3 ) gmg regimen : ( 2.4 )
warningsAndPrecautions: bkemv ( eculizumab-aeeb ) injection sterile , preservative-free , clear opalescent , colorless slightly yellow solution supplied one 300 mg/30 ml ( 10 mg/ml ) single-dose vial per carton ( ndc 55513-180-01 ) .
adverseReactions: bkemv contraindicated initiation patients unresolved serious neisseria meningitidis infection [ ( 5.1 ) ] .
indications_original: BKEMV is a complement inhibitor indicated for: The treatment of patients with paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH) to reduce hemolysis. ( 1.1 ) The treatment of patients with atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS) to inhibit complement-mediated thrombotic microangiopathy. ( 1.2 ) Limitation of Use BKEMV is not indicated for the treatment of patients with Shiga toxin E. coli related hemolytic uremic syndrome (STEC-HUS). The treatment of generalized myasthenia gravis (gMG) in adult patients who are anti-acetylcholine receptor (AchR) antibody positive. ( 1.3 )
contraindications_original: For intravenous infusion only PNH Dosage Regimen: ( 2.2 ) aHUS Dosage Regimen: ( 2.3 ) gMG Dosage Regimen: ( 2.4 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original: BKEMV (eculizumab-aeeb) injection is a sterile, preservative-free, clear to opalescent, colorless to slightly yellow solution supplied as one 300 mg/30 mL (10 mg/mL) single-dose vial per carton (NDC 55513-180-01).
adverseReactions_original:
BKEMV is contraindicated for initiation in patients with unresolved serious Neisseria meningitidis infection [see Warnings and Precautions (5.1)
                     ].
